title: Why do people ask you to talk but when you do, they don't listen? - Quora

response.answer_text: They just don’t listen. They already know what they want to say next, and are just waiting for you to pause, so they can jump back in. Listening is a skill that few people actually use. Conversely, people truly value a good listener…however, never seek to become one, themselves. I have successfully navigated my way out of many gatherings of people who clamor for my personal information…only to be derailed by me, flipping the question to them, and using my active listening skills. They get so lost in hearing their own voices, that I escape without ever answering their questions. People are funny creatures. When you do find someone that is good at listening, value that person!

Because people like to show general interest in what you have to say it’s like a formality they have to complete but realistically they don’t actually want to hear your life problems or even have any interest in them, this is because everyone believes their problems are bigger then others. To be honest, this isn’t everyone there are souls out there that will listen and be a shoulder of support but the ones that do as you stated are generally self-absorbed and not truly good people as life is all about sharing out the burden of problems especially within our individual social bubbles otherwise the pressure of life can become overbearing and often leads to people committing suicide.
